RainbruRPG::Options::OptionListAttribute

RainbruRPG::Options::OptionListAttribute Class Reference

#include <optionlistattribute.h>

Inheritance diagram for RainbruRPG::Options::OptionListAttribute:

[legend]
Collaboration diagram for RainbruRPG::Options::OptionListAttribute:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

An option storing a list of string.

It is used with the OptionManager and may be added to an OptionButton.

Definition at line 48 of file optionlistattribute.h.

void RainbruRPG::Options::OptionListAttribute::add ( const char *  it  ) 

Add a value to the list.

void RainbruRPG::Options::OptionAttribute::setType ( tOptionAttributeType  t  )  [inherited]

Set the type of the attribute.

Set OptionAttribute::type to t. If the type is OAT_UNKNOWN, a warning log message is sent to the Logger.

See also:
getType(), type.
Parameters:
t The new type of the attribute

Definition at line 47 of file optionattribute.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Options::OptionAttribute::setName ( const char *  n  )  [inherited]

Set the name of the attribute.

Logs a warning message if the name is empty. The control of the lenght of the string is done by std::strlen.

See also:
getName(), name
Parameters:
n The new name of the attribute

const char * RainbruRPG::Options::OptionAttribute::getToolTip (  )  [inherited]

Get the tooltip text of the attribute.

The name can contains space and other specials character but keep in mind this is used as the label of the option (in LauncherOptions dialog).

See also:
setToolTip(), tooltip

Definition at line 135 of file optionattribute.cpp.

Member Data Documentation

bool RainbruRPG::Options::OptionListAttribute::hasDefaultValue [private]

This attribute has set a default value.

The initial value of this boolean is false, when we first use add(), it is set to true and the value added is set using setValueStr()

Definition at line 79 of file optionlistattribute.h.

FXObject* RainbruRPG::Options::OptionAttribute::widget [protected, inherited]

The widget linked to this attribute.

For the update of the graphic representation of the attribute, we keep a pointer to the widget.
